definition: to be content with poverty and strive for virtue (idiom)
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: Now then you have chosen this poor industry, you should be content with it .
sentences.chinese: 既然選擇了這個清貧的行業，就要安貧樂道。

sentences.english: Fortunate are those who are poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
sentences.chinese: 安貧樂道的人是有福的，天國是他們的。

definition: On learning, classic book by Confucian philosopher Xun Zi 荀子 (c. 310-237 BC)
work or plans left as a legacy/the views of the departed/posthumous orders or teachings
to reach everywhere/to stop at nothing/to do one's utmost
to review the old and know the new (idiom, from the Analects)/to recall the past to understand the future
to plan and consider/to reflect on one's best strategy
Huailai county in Zhangjiakou 張家口|张家口[Zhang1 jia1 kou3], Hebei
Classic of Rites (same as 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4])
to keep an appointment/to keep one's word
